snippet: This week, the Supreme Court is to hear the case of Abigail Fisher, who said she was rejected by a university because she is white, drawing new attention to affirmative action’s constitutionality.
abstract: Supreme Court is set to hear case of Abigail Fisher, student who claims she was denied admission to the University of Texas because she is white; case draws renewed attention to combustible issues of the constitutionality of racial preferences in admissions decisions by public universities.
lead_paragraph: This week, the Supreme Court is to hear the case of Abigail Fisher, who said she was rejected by a university because she is white, drawing new attention to affirmative action’s constitutionality.

headline.seo: Supreme Court to Hear Case on Affirmative Action
headline.main: Race and College Admissions, Facing a New Test by Justices
headline.print_headline: Race and College Admissions, Facing a New Test by Justices
